did.unittitle: Manuscripts
"Idyls of Norway and Other Poems"[1882]

scopecontent.p: [Sonnets on "Evolution"; begins "I am the child of earth & air & sea. . ."]

did.unittitle: "Three Sonnets"

scopecontent.p: [Three sonnets beginning, "If I should lose thee, Darling. . ."; "I saw thee drifting. . ."; and "I wonder oft why God. . ."]

did.unittitle: Letters
Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesento Harriet Jackson

scopecontent.p: [Refuses to part with autograph letters of Ivan Tourguenettat Jackson's request; promises to ask Tourguenett to write a few lines for her which he will forward to her.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, Ithaca, New York, to Mrs. Foot

scopecontent.p: [Acknowledges her 2 letters; says he is overburdened with literary and professional work and apologizes for not answering sooner; mentions his failure to meet her in New York City; expects to go to Europefor a year's stay; talks at length about evolution, a subject which haunts him; looks at evolution theory in its Goetheaspect; says he has written a series of "scientific sonnets!" soon to be published, to clear his mind of the subject of evolution; looks forward to a long literary talk with her; notes she is working on a story or a book.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New Yorkto [ Alexander Wilson] Drake, [ New York]

scopecontent.p: [Discusses Norwegian painter Hammerstead who plans to settle in [ New York]; asks for Drake's help in bringing Hammerstead's paintings before the public.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, Nantucket, Massachusetts, to [Richard Watson] Gilder, [ New York]

scopecontent.p: [Encloses short poem which he feels good about; discusses a story he is working on.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to John M. Bunt

scopecontent.p: [Responds to Bunt's request for him to recall an important incident in his life by saying he has nothing to offer other than his birth, which was to long ago for him to remember it.]

did.unittitle: Charles Scribner, New York, to Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen

scopecontent.p: [Agrees to publish a volume of juvenile stories, Boyhood in Norway, 1892, for Boyesen in the autumn of the following year; discusses term of publication.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to [Samuel Sidney] McClure, [ New York]

scopecontent.p: [Sends the requested ballad intended for recitation, "The [ ] of A Song"; hopes it will suit him but promises not to be offended if it does not.]

did.unittitle: Charles Scribner, New York, to Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York

scopecontent.p: [Says he will gladly publish Boyesen's Essays on German Literature, 1892; says there will be a market for the book; offers a 10 percent; royalty; mentions juvenile stories.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to [Samuel Sidney] McClure, [ New York]

scopecontent.p: [Sends postage stamps for the return of the manuscript of his ballad; says he will have no further communication with McClure; marvels at his "cheek."]

did.unittitle: Charles Scribner, New York, to Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York

scopecontent.p: [Encloses a report on Essays on German Literatureand a royalty cheque; says Scribner's is willing to publish a companion volume, Essays on Scandinavian Literature, 1895, provided that certain conditions are met.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [Asks for a November 1884 copy of The Dial, in which a story of his on Hans Christian Andersonappears; intends include the story in Essays on Scandinavian Literature; congratulates Browne on the appearance and literary excellence of The Dial. ]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [States that he has written an article, not in the form of a book review, on Henrik Ibsen's play "Love's Comedy,"which has not yet been translated into English; offers his article to The Dialfor $20, though he could get twice that amount, because he values The Dial; mentions Hans Christian Andersonstory, his busy lecture schedule.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to Samuel Sidney McClure, [ New York]

scopecontent.p: [Decides to interpret his novel to write article on William Dean Howellsat once; requests prompt payment; asks to see proof before article goes to print; says he could easily sell the article to Cosmopolitan, should McClure not be pleased with it.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [Sends for approval if article on Henrik Ibsen, "The Wild Duck," which will be included in Essays On Scandinavian Literature; expects $20 for it.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [Assures him that there is no particular hurry to publish "The Wild Duck" as Scribner'swill not put out Essays On Scandinavian Literaturebefore 1895.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [Asks him to watch out for an article of his literary criticism which will appear in The Forum. ]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [Acknowledges $20; speaks highly of and recommends writers [James] Brander Matthews, George Edward Woodberry, and William Hamilton Gibsonwhom he likens to John Burroughs; says that George Parsons Lathropis interesting only to the select since he became Catholic.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [Says Browne's letter reached him at Columbiavia Genevaand Chicago; gives his impression of "The Fair," Columbia Exposition 1893in Chicago; sums it up as the most magnificent the world has to offer; is especially taken with the wonder of electrical illumination.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, Southampton, Long Island, to Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [Asks for the proof of "The Wild Duck" to be sent to Long Island, if Browne decides to publish it.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [Requests a copy of article on Hans Christian Anderson, published in The DialNovember 1884; intends to include it in Essays on Scandinavian Literature, to be published by Scribner 's; names other essays he will include in the volume.]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to Francis Fisher Browne, [ Chicago]

scopecontent.p: [Says he has found his own copy of the story on Hans Christian Anderson. ]

did.unittitle: Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, New York, to J. Howard Rhoads

scopecontent.p: [Says he has not published the lectures Rhoads refers to and that he does not intend to do so for a few years; says the substance of the lectures, with the exception of the lecture on Algernon Charles Swinburne, is in Literary and Social Silhouettes1894.]

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Keene Boyesen, Southampton, to William Stephen Rainsford, New York City

scopecontent.p: [Discusses the quality of Sunday school for children at St. George's; gives reasons for sending her son to St. Barthlomus; pleads with him to persuade her husband to remain a member of St. George, the church they were both confirmed in; expresses thoughts on Robert Browning. ]

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous
Hjalmar Hjorth Boyesen, [ New York] to Scribner & Co., New York City

scopecontent.p: [Receipt for the sum of $105.50.]
